conclusion: The v-t graph shows the velocity of the skydiver over time, with velocity in meters per second and time in seconds.
We are looking at the interval from 0 to 10 seconds.
From the graph, observe the velocity during the 0 to 10 seconds interval; the velocity is increasing.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity; if velocity is increasing, the acceleration is positive.
The slope of the tangent line to the curve at any point represents the acceleration at that point; the red tangent lines show that the slope is positive during the 0 to 10 seconds interval.
Since the velocity is increasing and the slope of the tangent lines is positive, the acceleration is positive.
